humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that there are 24 lymph nodes examined, and 2 of them are positive for metastatic carcinoma. This corresponds to the N1 stage based on the AJCC staging system, as per Rule 9 and New Rule 12 (N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes). The report also mentions that the largest nodal metastasis is 4 mm in diameter, which is consistent with N1 stage. The presence of extracapsular extension in one of the lymph nodes (Slide 1FS) also supports the N1 stage.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has 2 out of 24 examined lymph nodes with metastatic carcinoma, one of which has extracapsular extension. This is consistent with a pathologic N1a stage. The substaging information (N1a, N1b, etc.) is not required for this question, so we can simply use N1.
